title: Redesign Trip Planner UI to show Unified Best Flights
Robust Scraping Infrastructure
description:
Make scraping resilient with multiple fallback strategies and graceful degradation. Users should get value from the app without requiring API keys.

## Vision
Even when Google Flights changes their layout or rate limits aggressively, the scraper should continue working. 20+ fallback strategies with validation ensure data extraction succeeds.

## Principles
1. **Graceful degradation** - Always extract what's possible, never fail completely
2. **Multiple extraction paths** - 20+ CSS selectors per data point
3. **Validation at every step** - Verify extracted data makes sense
4. **API keys optional** - Core value works without paid APIs
5. **Self-healing** - Detect and adapt to layout changes

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 20+ fallback selectors for price extraction
- [ ] 10+ fallback selectors for airline, stops, duration
- [ ] Validation rules reject obviously wrong data
- [ ] Graceful degradation logs what failed and continues
- [ ] Works reliably without any API keys configured
- [ ] Auto-detection of layout changes with alerts
- [ ] Documentation of all fallback strategies

title: Multi-Fallback Price Extraction
description:
Implement 20+ CSS selector fallbacks for extracting prices from Google Flights.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Primary selector tries first (current implementation)
- [ ] 20+ fallback selectors in priority order
- [ ] Each selector has validation (price > 0, reasonable range)
- [ ] Logging shows which selector succeeded
- [ ] Tests with saved HTML snapshots

## Strategy
1. Try exact selectors first (fastest)
2. Fall back to class-based patterns
3. Fall back to ARIA/accessibility attributes
4. Fall back to text pattern matching
5. Fall back to DOM structure patterns

title: Multi-Fallback Flight Details Extraction
description:
Implement 10+ fallback strategies for extracting airline, stops, and duration.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Airline extraction with 10+ fallbacks
- [ ] Stops count extraction with 10+ fallbacks
- [ ] Duration extraction with 10+ fallbacks
- [ ] Validation (airline in known list, stops 0-4, duration reasonable)
- [ ] Graceful degradation (partial data OK)

## Currently Hardcoded
Lines 395-397 in google_flights.py currently return:
- airline: 'Unknown'
- stops: 0
- duration: 0

This feature implements proper extraction.

title: Data Validation Framework
description:
Implement validation rules to detect and reject obviously wrong data.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Price validation (min/max bounds, currency detection)
- [ ] Airline validation (known airline codes/names)
- [ ] Route validation (valid airport codes)
- [ ] Date validation (not in past, reasonable future)
- [ ] Stops validation (0-4 range, consistent with duration)
- [ ] Duration validation (reasonable for route distance)
- [ ] Validation results logged for debugging

## Rules Examples
- Price:  < price < ,000
- Duration: 30 min < duration < 48 hours
- Stops: 0-4 for any route
- Airline: Matches known airline database or reasonable pattern

title: Graceful Degradation System
description:
Implement graceful degradation that extracts partial data rather than failing completely.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Partial extraction succeeds (got price but not airline = OK)
- [ ] Confidence scores for extracted data
- [ ] Clear logging of what succeeded/failed
- [ ] UI shows confidence level for each data point
- [ ] Never fail silently - always log what went wrong

## Degradation Levels
1. Full data extracted (all fields)
2. Core data only (price, route, dates)
3. Price only (minimum viable)
4. Failure (no usable data)

title: Layout Change Detection
description:
Detect when Google Flights layout changes and alert for investigation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Track selector success rates over time
- [ ] Alert when success rate drops significantly
- [ ] Capture HTML snapshots on failures for debugging

## Detection Strategies
1. Monitor which fallback level is being used
2. Track extraction failure patterns
3. Compare page structure to saved templates
4. Alert when primary selectors fail consistently

title: Implement rolling-horizon price monitoring architecture
description:
## Problem
Current Trip Plan searching is a "snapshot refresh" approach that doesn't work well for long monitoring windows (1+ years). Google Flights only has data ~10 months out, so we need a smarter approach.

## Oracle's Recommended Architecture

### 1. Persistent Itinerary Queue ( table)
- Track every origin/destination/date combo to monitor
- Columns: 
- As time passes, new dates become bookable â†’ add to queue automatically

### 2. Append-Only Price Observations
- Never delete historical observations
- Each search adds observations, updates best price if lower
- Reuse  pattern with 

### 3. Priority-Based Sampling (Rate-Limit Friendly)
- 70% budget: Recheck current top K cheapest (validate deals still exist)
- 30% budget: Explore new date buckets for coverage
- Stratify bookable window by month, ensure at least 1 itinerary/bucket

### 4. Rolling Horizon Candidate Generation
- Each scheduler run: 
- Add new itinerary rows for dates that just became bookable
- Stop scheduling itineraries whose departure has passed

### 5. "Best Ever Still Valid" Materialized View
- Derive from observations: 
- Order by , take top N per destination
- Refresh after each run

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ]  table created with proper schema
- [ ] Itineraries auto-generated as dates become bookable
- [ ] Price observations stored append-only
- [ ] Priority sampling: recheck best deals + explore new dates
- [ ] Expired itineraries cleaned up (departure passed)
- [ ] UI shows "best ever" prices with freshness indicator
- [ ] Cap itineraries per plan to avoid explosion

## Effort
Medium (1-2 days)

- Current workaround: accumulate matches instead of replacing

title: Redesign Trip Planner as unified flight agent
description:
## Problem
Currently Trip Planner has a split experience:
- RSS deal matches shown in one section
- Google Flights search is separate manual action
- GF results aren't persisted - shown temporarily then lost
- No scheduled GF searches for Trip Plans

## User Vision
Trip Plan acts as an "agent" that:
1. Monitors ALL sources (Google Flights + any configured APIs + RSS)
2. Persists the BEST 3 matches from any source
3. Runs on schedule (based on check_frequency_hours)
4. Shows consolidated "Best Matches" prominently
5. User can check daily, eventually book when perfect match appears

## Solution
1. Create TripPlanMatch model to persist matches from any source
2. Add scheduled job for Trip Plan GF searches
3. Modify TripPlanSearchService to persist top matches
4. Update UI to show unified "Best Matches" section
5. Remove separate RSS vs GF paradigm

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Trip Plans search Google Flights on schedule
- [ ] Best 3-5 matches persisted per Trip Plan
- [ ] UI shows unified matches from all sources
- [ ] Each match has: source, price, dates, destination, booking link
- [ ] Matches update automatically based on check_frequency_hours
